Notes.Text:
This update for mutt fixes the following issue:

- CVE-2021-3181: Fixed a memory leak in recipient parsing (bsc#1181221).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: rfc822.c in Mutt through 2.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (mailbox unavailability) by sending email messages with sequences of semicolon characters in RFC822 address fields (aka terminators of empty groups). A small email message from the attacker can cause large memory consumption, and the victim may then be unable to see email messages from other persons.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:mutt-1.10.1-55.24.1
